questions.text: Also known as Childish Gambino, which actor played Earn Marks?
questions.explanation:
Donald Glover.

	Glover left his popular role on the show "Community" to focus on his stand up act, his musical career, and to develop his own show. "Atlanta" is the show that he created during that time. He acts and does stand up as Donald Glover, but when recording music he is known as Childish Gambino.

questions.text: How are Paper Boi and Earn related?
questions.explanation:
Cousins.

	Earn and Paper Boi (Brian Henry) are both cousins who live in Atlanta. While Earn is the main character, it's Paper Boi who first made it big as a rapper. Earn is very jealous of his cousin in the pilot.

questions.text: Famous rapper Paper Boi shot and killed 3 people in the opening scenes.
questions.explanation:
False.

	There was a scene where he showed off his gun while arguing with others in the parking lot of a store. The screen faded to black as a single gunshot was heard going off. No one was shown to have died, but near the end of the episode a news story reported that both Earn and Paper Boi were arrested.

questions.text: Who served as Paper Boi's manager?
questions.explanation:
Earn.

	During the pilot Earn convinced Paper Boi to let him manage his rap career. Paper Boi at first saw Earn as a leech, just wanting a piece of his money, but agreed to the deal. Earn came through and got Paper Boi's single played on the radio.

questions.text: Earn and Vanessa (his baby's mother) share a bed and an apartment, yet she still dates outside of the relationship.
questions.explanation:
True.

	They were talking in the apartment early in the pilot. She told him that she had parent teacher conferences that night and would be home around 11 p.m. When he questioned her being that late, she told him she had a date after work. He wasn't happy, but did make a joke about it to his daughter.

questions.text: While Earn and Paper Boi were talking, they noticed they were late for something. It was 4:30 p.m. What were they late for?
options: Picking their kids up at school
questions.explanation:
Smoking marijuana.

	It's tradition that many pot smokers light up at 4:20 p.m. each day. The scene after Paper Boi announces "we're late" they go outside and smoke in front of the apartment building.

questions.text: What was the name of Paper Boi's single?
questions.explanation:
Paper Boy.

	The single and the rapper shared a name, though not a spelling. Paper Boi, when not rapping, was known as Alfred Miles. The song referenced money or "paper."

questions.text: What college did Earn drop out of?
questions.explanation:
Princeton.

	He moved back to Atlanta just before the pilot. During the pilot it wasn't mentioned why he dropped out, only that his parents and cousin didn't know why. He was working a minimum wage job during the pilot and trying to find a way to make a better life for his daughter.

questions.text: What part of Paper Boi's car was damaged while he was listening to his single on the radio?
questions.explanation:
Driver side mirror.

	The scene both opened and closed the episode. One of the characters even mentioned that he had deja vu during the scene at the start of the episode.

questions.text: While riding on the bus, what did another passenger try to force Earn to eat?
questions.explanation:
A Nutella sandwhich.

	The man, sitting next to Earn while he was carrying his daughter, sat and made a sandwich. When he was done making the sandwich he turned to Earn and tried to force him to take a bite. They started to argue about it, when a cop car passed the bus. When Earn turned back, the man had gotten off the bus, leaving behind the jar of Nutella.
